Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2010 09:16PM kickazz wrote: Hello- so I just started rads 10-20-10.  I thought radiation was going to b easy compared to chemo and surgery- but it has been horible.  The techs are so insensitive, i feel like a science experiment.  One day last week I was talking with one of the techs-  I was saying how breast cancer doesnt run in my family and I wasnt even due for a mamogram till age 40-  and she sai "I guess it is just bad luck".  I just felt like crying.  In fact the next day I was crying and they  ( the two techs) just acted as if I wasnt.  It was weird.  I feel better this week and not so emotional- but its just so scary and the unknown of what it is doing and long term effects.  Ugghh-  Its just so.... u have cancer feeling
Posts.Title: October 2010 rads mamaof3bugs JFV

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 08:27PM kickazz wrote: I finished with rads 12-8 with TE, and just started with pain and arm heaviness about two weeks ago when i started with yoga.  I am so bummed tonight because now i cant do yoga-  my neck is so tight from it-  i have to go back to therapy- i am so worried about lymphedema.  Its like 2 steps forward and 3 steps back- ugh
Posts.Title: October 2010 rads mamaof3bugs JFV

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2010 07:11PM - edited Jun 20, 2010 07:20PM by kickazz Hi-I started chemo 6-4-10.  TCH.  I am on day 16 and my hair is starting to fall out.  I know I want to shave it, but I am so scared.I keep hoping it is just thinning and wont continue.  I am bummed this weekend... Ugh
Posts.Title: Chemo June 2010 Del9 grneyd5600

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2010 12:58PM kickazz wrote: Hi ladies.  I am om day 2 after my second round of TCH.  This time the fatigue hit me so much faster.  I also feel so bloated.  Its so hard some days walking past a mirror and see a bald, pale, bloated person looking back at me.  One of those days I guess.  I sure I will feel better tomorrow.  At least 2 down, 4 more rounds to go.  Hope u all are doing better today.
Posts.Title: Chemo June 2010 Del9 grneyd5600

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2010 11:58PM - edited Jun 23, 2010 12:03AM by kickazz NorthernGirl-  I has similar side effect of not chest pain, but short of breath like it was hard to deep breath and catch my breath.  I am a nurse and my oxygen levels were fine it was like I could feel my lungs-burning when I took deep breaths.  I would go for walks and just try to slow my breathing down and each day it was less now back to normal.  I even played soccer and was fine.  I have to go back for round two of six TCH on Friday- I am dreading it.
Posts.Title: Chemo June 2010 Del9 grneyd5600

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2010 12:27PM kickazz wrote: Hi ladies-long time reader, writing not as much.  Anyways, thought I would tell you guys I am done with chemo...YEAH  I was originally suppossed to have 6 rounds of TCH, but because I had such a good response and the tumor could not be felt anymore...we did a MRI.  The MRI showed the tumor disappeared as well as the lymph are normal size.  So I am off to surgery in two weeks, and still have rads as well.  But, I though I would share with you ladies to see if any of you might want toi request MRI?  I did total of 4 rounds, and depending on pathology I might have to do 2 more... but praying I dont.  Praying for you all.  Steph
Posts.Title: Chemo June 2010 Del9 grneyd5600

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2010 09:16PM - edited Jul 12, 2010 09:20PM by kickazz I am trying to get myself geared up for round three of TCH.  I have to have the Taxol super slow due to the feeling of shortness of breath.  I am dreading going back.  I am just starting to feel a little better.  The second time was so difficult- the fatigue, constipation, then an internal stitch from my port popped out.  Ugh.  Also I met my rad MD for after surgery- and the thought of radiation for 6 weeks.  I know I have to do all this- its just depressing sometimes.  Blah , blah, blah.  I will get through it, just SUCKS!
Posts.Title: Chemo June 2010 Del9 grneyd5600

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2010 08:11PM kickazz wrote: Thanks Di... I am just gonna go all GI Jane-  I need to keep remembering I am a warrior and I guess I will look the part- haha.  Ill just shave it tonight.  Its the big picture I need to focus on.  Steph
